info.description:
Open Data API for RTR-Netztest
 For further information, please consult <https://www.netztest.at/en/Opendata>
 For high-volume requests, please contact RTR (netztest@rtr.at) for instructions regarding the parameter "sender". Users with a registered sender ID can be informed in case of major interface changes.
 Data accessible via the Open Data Interface are made available under Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 (CC BY 4.0). Regarding privacy policy and terms of use, please refer to https://www.rtr.at/en/tk/netztestterms.
info.title: RTR NetTest OpenData

get.summary: Export open data as CSV or XLSX

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: Mandatory. The year that should be exported.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: Mandatory. The year that should be exported.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Mandatory. Either ZIP (CSV) or XLSX.

get.description:
Date fields have to be submitted as a number, representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since midnight, January 1st, 1970 or in the format “yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss”. The time is given in UTC.

Decimal point (Full Stop “.”) is always used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of a number written in decimal form. This is independent from the local or regional settings.

Numeric fields also allow using the comparators ‘>’ and ‘<’ (meaning ‘=>’ and ‘=<’ respectively). Dates have always to be queried as ranges by using these comparators.

String fields allow using the wildcard ‘*’ for matching any literals and ‘?’ for matching one arbitrary literal.

It is possible, to begin each filter argument with an exclamation mark (!) to negate the filter. E.g. network_type=!LAN will yield all tests where the network type was not LAN.

The criteria denoted with [] can be used more than once in a query. Data has to match all criteria. If an array for one criterion is given, the data has to match each entry.

Generally a query on a parameter value ‘null’ is not possible, except for the parameter loc_accuracy, where the value -1 means ‘null’. Non-‘null’ values are queried with any single or multiple values.

parameters.name: download_kbit
parameters.description: Download speed in kilobit per second

parameters.name: upload_kbit
parameters.description: Upload speed in kilobit per second.

parameters.name: ping_ms
parameters.description: Median ping (round-trip time) in milliseconds, measured on the server side. In previous versions (before June 3rd 2015) this was the minimum ping measured on the client side.

parameters.name: gkz
parameters.description: Community ID (Gemeindekennzahl, see <http://www.bev.gv.at/portal/page?_pageid=713,2601287&_dad=portal&_schema=PORTAL>).

parameters.name: gkz_sa
parameters.description: Community ID (Gemeindekennzahl, see <http://www.statistik.at/web_de/klassifikationen/regionale_gliederungen/gemeinden/index.html>)

parameters.name: cat_technology
parameters.description: Technology category of the network, e.g. “3G”, “4G”, “WLAN”.

parameters.name: client_version
parameters.description: Software version number of the client.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Name of the device used.

parameters.name: network_name
parameters.description: Display name of the mobile network.

parameters.name: network_type
parameters.description: Type of the network, e.g. MOBILE, LAN, WLAN.

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Platform on which the test has been conducted

parameters.name: signal_strength
parameters.description: Signal strength (RSSI) in dBm.

parameters.name: open_uuid
parameters.description: Open-UUID: Identifies the client that conducted the test. The a new Open-UUID is assigned to the client on a regular basis.

parameters.name: open_test_uuid
parameters.description: The UUID of the test.

parameters.name: client_uuid
parameters.description: The private UUID of a client

parameters.name: test_uuid
parameters.description: The private UUID of a test

parameters.name: long
parameters.description: Longitude of the client position.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude of the client position.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in meters defining based on lat/long parameters

parameters.name: mobile_provider_name
parameters.description: mobile operator name

parameters.name: provider_name
parameters.description: Name of the internet service provider.

parameters.name: sim_mcc_mnc
parameters.description: Network identification of the SIM provider. The digits of MCC and MNC have the same meaning as described in “network_mcc_mnc”.

parameters.name: sim_country
parameters.description: Home country of the SIM card in ISO 3166.

parameters.name: network_country
parameters.description: Country of the network in ISO 3166.

parameters.name: country_geoip
parameters.description: Country according client IP address.

parameters.name: country_location
parameters.description: Country of geo-location.

parameters.name: user_server_selection
parameters.description: Legacy

parameters.name: loc_accuracy
parameters.description: Estimation of accuracy of client location in meters

parameters.name: public_ip_as_name
parameters.description: Name of the AS of the clients public IP.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: UTC date and time when test was started.

parameters.name: radio_band
parameters.description: Radio band used when conducting the test.

parameters.name: cell_area_code
parameters.description: Number describing the coarse location of a cell. E.g. the Tracking Area Code (TAC) in case of 4G or the Location Area Code (LAC) in case of 2G or 3G

parameters.name: cell_location_id
parameters.description: Number identifying the location of a cell. E.g. the 28-bit Cell Identity (CI) in case of 4G, the 28-bit UMTS Cell Identity (CID) in case of UMTS or the 16-bit GSM Cell Identity (CID) in case of GSM.

parameters.name: additional_info
parameters.description: additional properties to return

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired output format, either 'csv' or 'json', default: json

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: The field for which the data are sorted. Valid fields are: “download_kbit", "upload_kbit", "time", "signal_strength" and "ping_ms"

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description:
The sort_by-Parameter specifies the field, the sort_order-Parameter specifies the direction ('asc' or 'desc').
 Per Default, the results are sorted by the time of the test in descending order (i.e. sort_by=time&sort_order=desc).
 If the sort parameters are specified, the value of the cursor is a multiple of the parameter max_results, otherwise it is an arbitrary number.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description:
This is the page size, i.e. maximum number of result items that are returned per page.
 The default value is 100 items per page. The page size limit is 10000 items, i.e. not more than 10000 results can be displayed in a page.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: used for pagination if the query returns more than the number of items according to parameter max_results. The value to be used for the display of the next page is given by the previous response in returned parameter next_cursor.

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: Sender ID

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Alias '_'. Will be ignored and can be used to prevent caching of the response.

get.description: Query for a specific measurement result

parameters.name: open-test-uuid
parameters.description: Mandatory. The open-test-uuid of the test.

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description: Optional. If >0 the threadwise speed curve is additionally returned.

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: Optional. ID of the sender, for authentification.

cid.description: 16-bit GSM Cell Identity described in TS 27.007, 0..65535

frequency_dl.description: Frequency of the downlink in MHz

cid.description: CID 28-bit UMTS Cell Identity described in TS 25.331, 0..268435455

psc.description: 9-bit UMTS Primary Scrambling Code described in TS 25.331, 0..511

frequency_dl.description: Frequency of the downlink in MHz
Frequency of the downlink in MHz

bearing.description: Direction of travel of the hosting device in degrees, where 0° ≤ bearing < 360°, counting clockwise relative to the true north

speed.description: Speed of the client device in meters per second

altitude.description: Altitude of the client position in meters

loc_accuracy.description: Estimation of accuracy of client location.

time_elapsed.description: The time elapsed since the start of the test in milliseconds.

loc_src.description: Source for the geo location-data. Values: “gps”, “network”.

download_kbit.description: Download speed in kilobit per second

upload_kbit.description: Upload speed in kilobit per second

ping_ms.description: Median ping (round-trip time) in milliseconds, measured on the server side. In previous versions (before June 3rd 2015) this was the minimum ping measured on the client side.

platform.description:
Platform on which the test has been conducted. E.g.
* “Android” (= Google Android App),
* “iOS” (= Apple iOs App),
* Applet (= Java applet test within a browser),
* RMBTjs (= simple JavaScript test within a browser, without Java),
* RMBTws (= advanced JavaScript test using WebSockets within the browser).

provider_name.description: Name of the internet service provider.

loc_accuracy.description: Estimation of accuracy of client location in meters

download_classification.description:
Classification for the download speed in a traffic-light system.

0 = unknown, 1 = red, 2 = yellow, 3 = green.

upload_classification.description:
Classification for the upload speed in a traffic-light system.

0 = unknown, 1 = red, 2 = yellow, 3 = green.

ping_classification.description:
Classification for the ping speed in a traffic-light system.

0 = unknown, 1 = red, 2 = yellow, 3 = green.

download_kbit.description: Download speed in kilobit per second

upload_kbit.description: Upload speed in kilobit per second

ping_ms.description: Median ping (round-trip time) in milliseconds, measured on the server side. In previous versions (before June 3rd 2015) this was the minimum ping measured on the client side.

platform.description:
Platform on which the test has been conducted. E.g.
* “Android” (= Google Android App),
* “iOS” (= Apple iOs App),
* Applet (= Java applet test within a browser),
* RMBTjs (= simple JavaScript test within a browser, without Java),
* RMBTws (= advanced JavaScript test using WebSockets within the browser).

provider_name.description: Name of the internet service provider.

loc_accuracy.description: Estimation of accuracy of client location in meters

download_classification.description:
Classification for the download speed in a traffic-light system.

0 = unknown, 1 = red, 2 = yellow, 3 = green.

upload_classification.description:
Classification for the upload speed in a traffic-light system.

0 = unknown, 1 = red, 2 = yellow, 3 = green.

distance.description: The distance that the user moved in meters.

ping_classification.description:
Classification for the ping speed in a traffic-light system.

0 = unknown, 1 = red, 2 = yellow, 3 = green.

cat_technology.description: Technology category of the network, e.g. “3G”, “4G”, “WLAN”.

network_type.description: Type of the network, e.g. MOBILE, LAN, WLAN.

loc_src.description: Source for the geo location-data. Values: “gps”, “network”.

public_ip_as_name.description: Name of the AS of the clients public IP.

kg_nr.description: Number of the cadastral community, see <http://www.bev.gv.at/portal/page?_pageid=713,2601287&_dad=portal&_schema=PORTAL>

land_cover.description: Classification of the land cover within austria, see <http://www.umweltbundesamt.at/fileadmin/site/umweltthemen/raumplanung/1_flaechennutzung/corine/CORINE_Nomenklatur.pdf> and <https://www.eea.europa.eu/data-and-maps/data/clc-2006-vector-4>

locality.description: Name of the cadastral community, see: <http://www.bev.gv.at/portal/page?_pageid=713,2601287&_dad=portal&_schema=PORTAL>

pinned.description: _True_, if if the test is relevant for generating the statistics (e.g. not part of a series)

test_duration.description: Duration of the test per direction (up- or download) in seconds.

num_threads_requested.description: Number of threads requested by the server.

num_threads.description: Number of threads used for the downlink test.

num_threads_ul.description: Number of threads used for the uplink test.

model_native.description: Name of the device used, raw device name.

client_version.description: Software version number of the client.

network_mcc_mnc.description: Network identification whereas the first three digits represent the country, the digits following the dash represent the mobile network provider within that country.

network_country.description: Country of the network in ISO 3166.

roaming_type.description:
Integer representing the roaming status of the client:
* 0: no roaming,
* 1: national roaming,
* 2: international roaming.

network_name.description: Display name of the mobile network.

sim_mcc_mnc.description: Network identification of the SIM provider. The digits of MCC and MNC have the same meaning as described in “network_mcc_mnc”.

sim_country.description: Home country of the SIM card in ISO 3166.

connection.description: Type of connection in terms of NAT and IP-Version (e.g. behind NAT with local to public IP and IPv4).

ip_anonym.description: The anonymized IP-Address of the client.

ndt_download_kbit.description: Download speed in the NDT-test in kilobit per second.

ndt_upload_kbit.description: Upload speed in the NDT-test in kilobit per second.

country_asn.description: Country of AS of client IP.

bytes_download.description: Total number of bytes downloaded during download test (excluding training-phase).

bytes_upload.description: Total number of bytes uploaded during upload test (excluding training-phase).

test_if_bytes_download.description: Data volume received on the interface during the test (including training phase).

test_if_bytes_upload.description: Data volume transmitted on the interface during the test (including training phase).

testdl_if_bytes_download.description: Data volume received on the interface during the download test.

testdl_if_bytes_upload.description: Data volume transmitted on the interface during the download test.

testul_if_bytes_download.description: Data volume received on the interface during the upload test.

testul_if_bytes_upload.description: Data volume transmitted on the interface during the upload test.

duration_download_ms.description: Duration of download test in ms.

duration_upload_ms.description: Duration of upload test in ms.

time_dl_ms.description: Relative start time of download in ms.

time_ul_ms.description: Relative start time of upload in ms.

channel_number.description: Channel number of the radio channel used during a measurement. E.g. the 18-bit Absolute RF Channel Number (EARFCN) in case of 4G or the 16-bit UMTS Absolute RF Channel Number (UARFCN) in case of 3G.

radio_band.description: Radio band used when conducting the test.

cell_area_code.description: Number describing the coarse location of a cell. E.g. the Tracking Area Code (TAC) in case of 4G or the Location Area Code (LAC) in case of 2G or 3G

cell_location_id.description: Number identifying the location of a cell. E.g. the 28-bit Cell Identity (CI) in case of 4G, the 28-bit UMTS Cell Identity (CID) in case of UMTS or the 16-bit GSM Cell Identity (CID) in case of GSM.

signal_classification.description: Classification for the signal strength in a traffic-light system.

wifi_link_speed.description: WLAN link speed according to the Android API.

speed_curve.description: Aggregated history of transferred data bytes during a test.

speed_curve_threadwise.description: History of transferred data bytes per thread during a test. Returned only if verbose>0.

loc_accuracy.description: Estimation of accuracy of client location in meters

download_kbit.description: Download speed in kilobit per second

upload_kbit.description: Upload speed in kilobit per second

ping_ms.description: Median ping (round-trip time) in milliseconds, measured on the server side. In previous versions (before June 3rd 2015) this was the minimum ping measured on the client side.

platform.description:
Platform on which the test has been conducted. E.g.
* “Android” (= Google Android App),
* “iOS” (= Apple iOs App),
* Applet (= Java applet test within a browser),
* RMBTjs (= simple JavaScript test within a browser, without Java),
* RMBTws (= advanced JavaScript test using WebSockets within the browser).

download.description: Measurements of downloaded bytes at various times during the test.

upload.description: Measurements of uploaded bytes at various times during the test.

ping.description: The client’s pings throughout the test

signal.description: Measurements of signal strength and network type at various times during the test.

location.description: The client’s locations throughout the test.

duration_ms.description: duration of the search request in milliseconds

invalid_fields.description: Invalid fields in the search request

ping_ms.description: Ping (round-trip time) in milliseconds, measured on the server side.

time_elapsed.description: The time elapsed since the start of the test in milliseconds.
The time elapsed since the start of the test in milliseconds.

network_type.description: Type of the network, e.g. GSM, EDGE, UMTS, HSPA, LTE, LAN, WLAN…

cat_technology.description: Technology category of the network, e.g. “3G”, “4G”, “WLAN”.

cell_info_2G.description: Additional information about the used 2G radio cell

cell_info_3G.description: Additional information about the used 3G radio cell

cell_info_4G.description: Additional information about the used 4G radio cell

bytes_total.description: The sum of all bytes transferred since the start of the test phase.

time_elapsed.description: The time elapsed since the start of the test phase in milliseconds.

bytes_total.description: The sum of all bytes transferred since the start of the test phase.

time_elapsed_ns.description: The time elapsed since the start of the test phase for this thread, in nanoseconds.
